description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1gsd0","text":"This protocol provides the staining process for GeoMx digital spatial profiling of mouse brain used in in Carver et al., \"Senescent- and disease-associated microglia are modifiable features of aged brain white matter\". T","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ephjo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rjks","text":"Sections were cut at 5 Î¼m from FFPE blocks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5519n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6sg5q","text":"Brain slices were adhered to glass slides and stained directly on the surface","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74bes","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85a6k","text":"The immunostaining process involves unconjugated- or fluorophore-conjugated- primary antibodies and secondary antibodies conjugated to fluorophores. Due to old brain accumulation of lipofuscin granules that autofluoresce, we note that in order to achieve maximal signal, a quenching step is performed to extinguish the autofluorescent noise.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"u7s5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ottj","text":"Transcriptome in situ hybridiazation was performed with the GeoMx Whole Transcriptome Atlas for mouse.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dl4hi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a08u6","text":"Sections were imaged and processed on the GeoMx digital spatial profiling machine platform.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"ce0h6","text":"This research complies with all ethical regulations, research practices, and experimental protocols by the\nMayo Clinic Institutional Animal Care and Committee. All experiments involving animals performed in this study were approved by Mayo Clinic Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee and guidelines for\nethical animal research were followed from the NIH Guide for the Care and Use of Laboratory Animals. Prior ethics approval should be obtained before performing any experiments cited herein.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: aged brain spatial profiling, digital spatial profiling of mouse brain, modifiable features of aged brain white matter, aged brain white matter, geomx whole transcriptome atlas for mouse, old brain accumulation of lipofuscin granule, associated microglia, geomx digital spatial profiling machine platform, old brain accumulation, staining process for geomx, geomx whole transcriptome atlas, digital spatial profiling machine platform, digital spatial profiling, mouse brain, transcriptome in situ hybridiazation, fluorophore, autofluorescent noise, autofluoresce, lipofuscin granule

parent_collections.title: Carver et al., Aged Brain Spatial Profiling Collection

protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"cesvi","text":"MAN-10150-03 GeoMx DSP Manual Slide Preparation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ecj68","text":"SEV-00087-05 GeoMx NGS DSP Instrument User Manual","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6lctm","text":"For FFPE sections, follow procedures found in document   including summaries here:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":55,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fsvp0","text":"1) Slide Preparation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpnfv","text":"2) Bake slides","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"168sq","text":"3) Deparaffinize and rehydrate FFPE tissue sections","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6aemu","text":"4) Perform target retrieval","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1btpj","text":"5) Expose RNA targets","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7ru2","text":"6) Postfix: preserve tissue morphology for soft tissues","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63c00","text":"7) In situ hybridization","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":3,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"em32n","text":"8) Perform stringent washes to remove off-target probes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9929p","text":"At the point in which morphology markers are ready to be applied, follow steps below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"","id":410595,"original_name":"MAN-10150-03_GeoMx_DSP_Manual_Slide_Prep_User_Manual.pdf","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","size":4090320,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ns9db87vp.pdf"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bitsq","text":"Dilute stock 40X True Black Plus aqueous (Biotium, catalogue #23014) to 1X in PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83k8g","text":"Incubate sections in 1X True Black Plus for 10 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bv3ou","text":"Note: any residual detergents may interfere with quenching efficacy","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3t77j","text":"Remove quenching solution and wash sections thoroughly with cold PBS 5 times for 5 minutes each","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aclme","text":"Stain sections in primary antibody solution diluted with GeoMx blocking buffer W","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5m1if","text":"Antibody combinations consist of:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"414q5","text":"rabbit polyclonal anti-IBA1 (Fujifilm Wako, #019-19741, RRID:AB_839504)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3g0r","text":"     dilution: 1:500","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3iv2","text":"rat IgG2Amonoclonal anti-galectin-3 clone eBioM3/38 preconjugated to eFluor 660 (Invitrogen, #50-5301-82, RRID:AB_11220276)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":7,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"asvr4","text":"     dilution: 1:200\ngoat polyclonal anti-GFAP (Abcam, #ab53554, RRID:AB_880202)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eethr","text":"     dilution: 1:2000","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3a210","text":"SYTO 83 Orange Fluorescent Nucleic Acid Stain (Invitrogen, #S11364)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aicrc","text":"    dilution: 5 Î¼M","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"du9di","text":"Remove antibody solution and wash sections thoroughly with cold PBS 3 times for 5 minutes each","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"88bjc","text":"Stain sections with donkey-host secondary antibodies conjugated to fluorophores AF488, AF594, or AF647 (Jackson Immunoresearch) for 2 hours at 25C in dark room environment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53ngj","text":"Antibodies consist of:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3c7mh","text":"      Donkey anti-rabbit IgG AF488 (1:250)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gn67","text":"      Donkey anti-GFAP IgG AF594 (1:250)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9n644","text":"Remove antibody solution Wash sections thoroughly with cold PBS 3 times for 5 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f61uu","text":"After receiving the images created by GeoMx, set the following segmentation order:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"474na","text":"1) IBA1+ , GFAP-, GAL3-","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42ggk","text":"2) GAL3+, IBA1+, GFAP ignore","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pl37","text":"3) IBA1+, GAL3+, GFAP ignore","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
